case.name: Huntley Management Limited (ACN 089 240 513) v Australian Olives Limited (ACN 078 885 042) [2009] FCA 1081 (24 September 2009)

citphrases.citphrase: whether money taken out of fund containing application fees of members continues to be scheme property
whether money subject to fixed charge in favour of responsible entity
successor responsible entity to exercise rights in relation to charge corporations act 2001 (cth) ss 9 , 279
distinction between indispensable, necessary and proper parties
limitation of compensation payable to any number of "claimants in respect of or arising out of all occurrences of a series consequent on or attributable to one source or original cause"
actions for damages by or on behalf of children born with deformities brought about by drug distributed by insured
prohibition on insured making admission in connexion with claim
whether applicable where insurer declines to take over defence of action.
high court rules, o. 26, r. 18. patents
use for services of commonwealth or state
construction of carriages for use in state railway system

citances.sentence: This is the third judgment relating to proceedings filed by the Applicants on 18 March 2009. The nature and content of the proceedings was summarised in Huntley Management Limited (ACN 089 240 513) v Australian Olives Limited (ACN 078 885 042) [2009] FCA 1081 and Huntley Management Limited (ACN 089 240 513) v Australian Olives Limited (ACN 078 885 042) [2010] FCA 579. These reasons for decision adopt the same abbreviations as the earlier decisions.

These proceedings were filed by the Applicants on 18 March 2009. The nature and content of the proceedings was summarised in Huntley Management Limited (ACN 089 240 513) v Australian Olives Limited (ACN 078 885 042) [2009] FCA 1081.
